privacy_p1: Your privacy is paramount. This application is designed to run entirely locally in your browser.
privacy_p2: Data Storage: All the information you enter (schedules, classes, student names, annotations, etc.) is saved exclusively in your web browser's local storage (LocalStorage), on your own computer. No data is sent to any external server.
privacy_p3: Backups: When you use the "Save" feature, a .json file is generated and downloaded to your computer. This file contains all your data, and you are solely responsible for its safekeeping. When using "Open", the data from that file will replace the data currently stored in the browser.
privacy_p4: Data of Minors: The application may contain data of minors (names and annotations). It is your responsibility as a user to comply with the data protection regulations in force in your country or region regarding the management of this information.
privacy_p5: Your data is yours, it stays on your device, and it never leaves unless you decide to export it.
manual_welcome: Welcome to the Class Journal. This guide will help you set up and use all the features of the application.
manual_getting_started_p1: To start using the application, the first step is to set up your classes, schedules, and students. All of this is managed from the Settings tab.
manual_getting_started_li1: Define the Calendar: In Settings > Calendar, set the start and end dates for the course, as well as terms and holidays.
manual_getting_started_li2: Create Time Slots: In Settings > Schedule, add the time slots for your day (e.g., "08:00-09:00"). You can use the automatic generator to create them quickly.
manual_getting_started_li3: Create Your Activities/Classes: In Settings > Activities & Students, add the subjects or groups you teach.
manual_getting_started_li4: Set Up Your Base Schedule: Back in Settings > Schedule, use the table to assign each activity to its corresponding day and time slot.
manual_getting_started_li5: Add Your Students: Go to the Classes tab or the "Activities Management" section in Settings to add students to each class.
manual_settings_p1: The Settings section is organized into tabs to make it easier to access the different options.
manual_settings_calendar_p1: This tab allows you to define the temporal structure of your course for more precise organization.
manual_settings_terms_p1: Here you can define evaluation periods (terms, semesters, etc.). This allows filtering annotations and student tracking by specific periods from the Schedule view.
manual_settings_holidays_p1: Add holidays or non-school periods. These days will appear shaded in the schedule to help with your planning.
manual_settings_schedule_p1: In this tab, you configure the structure of your weekly schedule.
manual_settings_generator_p1: Use the generator to quickly create the time slots for your day. You can also add, delete, or reorder them manually.
manual_settings_weekly_p1: Use the table to assign each of your activities (previously created) to the corresponding day and time slot. This will be your default schedule.
manual_settings_overrides_p1: If a class is replaced by another for a period of time (e.g., for a special project or a field trip), you can create an override here. It will take precedence over the base schedule for the dates you specify.
manual_settings_activities_li1: Create Activities: Enter a name, choose a type (class with students or general), and click "Add". A color is assigned automatically, but you can change it by clicking on it.
manual_settings_activities_li2: Edit Activities: Click on an activity's name to change it or to set specific start and end dates for that subject (different from the general course dates).
manual_settings_activities_li3: Assign Students: Within each "class" type activity, you can view and manage the student list.
manual_students_import_p1: Use this tool to add many students at once. Simply select the destination class and paste the list of names (one per line) into the text area.
manual_settings_data_p1: This section contains sensitive options for managing all your data.
manual_data_delete_p1_new:
In the "Danger Zone" of the Settings page, you can permanently delete all application data. This action cannot be undone, so use it with caution.

The Import schedule only button allows you to recover only the timetable from previously saved data. All other data (subjects, students, and notes) will be lost.
manual_schedule_usage_p1: The Schedule view is your daily hub.
manual_schedule_usage_li1: Navigation: Use the arrows to move between weeks, the "Today" button to return to the current week, or click on the date to display a selector and jump to any week of the course.
manual_schedule_usage_li2: Filter by Term: Use the term selector to view only the classes and annotations corresponding to that period.
manual_schedule_usage_li3: View a Session: Click on any class block in the schedule to open the detail view for that session.
manual_schedule_usage_li4: Session Logging: In the detail view, you can note the plan, write a summary of what was done, and add individual notes for each student.
manual_schedule_usage_li5: Navigate between sessions: Within a class's detail view, you can use the "Previous session" and "Next session" buttons to move chronologically through all classes for that same activity.
manual_schedule_usage_li6: Print: You can print a simplified version of the weekly schedule.
manual_students_classes_tab_p1: Here you can see all your classes and the list of students in each one. It's a good place to quickly add or remove students from a class or to directly access a student's file.
manual_students_file_p1: To access the file, click on a student's name from the Classes view or from a session's detail view. In the file, you can:
manual_students_file_li2: See which classes they are enrolled in.
manual_students_file_li3: Add general notes about the student that are not specific to a particular session.
manual_students_file_li4: View and edit the complete history of notes for that student across all sessions.
manual_students_file_li5: Export to DOCX and print a complete file with all their information.
manual_data_p1: All information is saved locally in your browser. This means the data is private and only accessible from the device and browser where you created it.
manual_data_backup_p1: The buttons to manage your data are now located in the main Schedule view, in the upper right corner.
manual_data_backup_li1_new: Save: Click this button to download a .json file with all your data (schedule, classes, students, notes, etc.). Save this file in a safe place as a backup.
manual_data_backup_li2_new: Open: If you switch computers or want to restore a backup, use this button and select the .json file you saved. Warning! This will replace all current data in the application.
